dt.t: an uncritical acceptance of {wi}novelty{/wi} as advance

dt: {bc}a small manufactured article intended mainly for personal or household adornment
{bc}something (such as a song or food item) that provides often fleeting amusement and is often based on a theme

dt.t: The movie included a few {wi}novelty{/wi} songs.

et: Middle English {it}novelte,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}novelté,{/it} from {it}novel{/it} "new, {et_link|novel:1|novel:1}" + {it}-té{/it} {et_link|-ty|-ty}
shortdef: the quality or state of being novel : newness
a small manufactured article intended mainly for personal or household adornment —usually used in plural
